title: Methodologies for Assessing Medical Student Learning Through Structured Clinical Practice

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Measuring learning outcomes using clinical scenario-based assessment tools (written exams, OSCEs, patient simulators) related to critical care medicine.

learning_goals: Students can perform appropriate diagnostic and intervention procedures in critical care scenarios with 80% accuracy
Students can achieve an average score of 75 or higher across five stations in OSCE (Objective Structured Clinical Examination) assessment items
Students can reduce data interpretation and decision-making time to within 2 minutes when using patient simulators
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
